wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Francis "Ginger" Neil,  (14 July 1920 – 11 July 2018) was a British aviator, fighter pilot and flying ace in the Royal Air Force. Neil flew during the Battle of Britain, and shot down 14 enemy aircraft during the Second World War.

response: **Tom Neil, British RAF flying ace who downed 14 enemy aircraft in World War II; in Bootle, Merseyside (d. 2018)
* Tom Neil DFC (1920-2018), Battle of Britain pilot
**Tom Neil, 97, English fighter pilot (Battle of Britain), member of The Few.
